    +--------+
+---+ Review +-----------------------------------------------------------------+
|   +--------+                                                                 |
|   Those accustomed to the great traditional recordings of Chopin's           |
|   preludes will possibly react very strongly to Pogorelich's version. I'm    |
|   certainly no exception. Pogorelich will dazzle listeners with his          |
|   inhuman, lightning-quick technique, only to later infuriate them with      |
|   achingly slow tempi. Yet, I must admit that his impeccable, if not often   |
|   pedantic and conceited, pianism never fails to fascinate me. It offers a   |
|   new and refreshing perspective on Chopin's music and piano playing in      |
|   general. Old-school fundamentalists have the right to hate this            |
|   recording, but I encourage you to listen to it as you would embrace a      |
|   new experience.                                                            |
|                                                                              |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
